newsitem.title: POLAND: Poland sold 21.5 million mass privatisation units.
newsitem.headline: Poland sold 21.5 million mass privatisation units.

text.p: Poland sold about 668,000 mass privatisation units last week, bringing the total number of units sold since the start of the sale in 1995 to about 21,512,000 units, the treasury ministry said in a statement.
In the week ending October 18, 681,000 units were sold.
The National Investment Fund (NFI) units, which started trading on the Warsaw bourse on July 15, have been on sale since November 1995 and will be offered until late November 1996.
Under the NFI programme each of Poland's 28 million adults can buy one unit for 20 zlotys, later to be exchanged for shares in each of the 15 NFIs.
The funds group more than 500 firms undergoing privatisation.
The National Securities Depository (KDPW) has so far transformed 7.3 million of the certificates into paperless book-entry form, necessary for bourse trading.
